intro: Paropsia argutidens, commonly known as the sharp-leaved paropsia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
